EXTRACTED VALUE: Enemy Territory: Quake Wars had the right idea, but this war might be a little too much for the mighty army of the Strogg.
In the end, the game really is just too human: flawed, ageing but with the potential to do great things.
It's perfect for action junkies who love visceral and brutal fighting but hate to think about things.
There are a lot of great ideas contained in the game, but overall the game falls flat and leaves you feeling greatly unsatisfied.
The variety of online play is a great boost to replay value, as you can play for hours without having the same game experience twice.
This isn't fun, this is sloppy. Fights devolve into senseless button and stick mashing, and often lead to a lot of controller throwing moments.
But ultimately, it's hard to whole-heartedly recommend this game to anyone but the most diehard turn-based--RPG fanatics. [Oct. 2006, p.73]
"Motorstorm" does off-road racing better than this. So does "Dirt" and "Sega Rally Revo". [Jan 2008, p.94]
We can't help but feel that Burst Limit is an opportunity lost.
Sure, the graphics in Full Auto are great and lots of stuff goes boom, but so many other games just plain play better.
